Introduction

Lee JaiJin is a South Korean singer, rapper, dancer and artist, he is the main dancer of first generation idol boy group SECHSKIES under YG Entertainment.
He first made his debut with SECHSKIES on May 14, 1997 with the album School Byeolgok and went on to make his solo debut on November 19, 2001 with the studio album "S.Wing".

JaiJin began his mandatory military service in 2006, after releasing his final solo album "It's New". After being discharged, he had withdrawn from the entertainment industry and went to Japan to study.

In 2015 and 2016, he participated in group exhibitions, "Imagination Alliance 2" and "Imagination Alliance 3", in GALERIE GAIA under his pseudonym HANZO.

In 2016, JaiJin had reunited with SECHSKIES, having a reunion concert through the variety show Infinite Challenge. The group had later signed a contract with YG Entertainment to start promotions again, after their sudden disbandment in 2000. JaiJin and fellow member Kang SungHoon had also signed exclusive solo contracts with YG Entertainment.
